Begin Mini-Page 598171
Membership
Countryside Golf and Country Club is a private gated community with 1133 units comprised of 850 golf memberships and 283 social memberships.
In order to be a member of the club you must own property within Countryside. The type of property you own determines your level of Membership: Golf, or Social with Limited Golf. Memberships are deeded with the property purchased and are non-transferrable. There are 34 neighborhood associations plus the Master HOA.
Benefits
Countryside offers its members a par 70 , 18-hole private golf course, a practice range, short game practice rang and two putting greens, reciprocal golf and dining privileges with select local Golf & country clubs (May through October), private lessons, and golf clinics, lit Har-Tru tennis courts, fitness center, tennis courts, pool and spa. Recently completed 2 Har-Tru Bocce courts,  a Wellness Center with locker rooms, fitness, member recreation areas and meeting space.
Golf Membership
A golf membership entitles the owner to the full use of all facilities and the golf course year round. You cannot purchase a golf membership separate from a home or change membership to a golf membership if the unit you own is deeded as a social membership.
Social Membership with Limited Golf
A social membership entitles the owner to the full use of all facilities year round and the golf course from May through October. You cannot change membership to a golf membership if the unit you own is deeded as a social membership.
Neighborhood Association Fees
Most associations have a quarterly condo fee which covers costs specific to that association; therefore, fees vary from neighborhood to neighborhood.
Prior to Closing
Please contact Deb Rex via e-mail at
[email protected]
or call 239-353-1780 x103 to receive a new owner booklet and packet to review. Completing the packet and returning the forms to Deb will help expedite establishing your account after you close.
Closing Costs
Paid to Countryside by Seller
All-outstanding Club Charges on the member's account
Paid to Countryside by Buyer
Estoppel Fee
Capital Contribution Fee
Remaining Food Minimum
Other
Prorated portion of the already paid annual assessment and condo fees may also be included which are then reimbursed to the previous owner.
After the Closing
Both the Deed and actual closing check must be received prior to establishing your membership account.  Membership established by the Master Association provides access to the amenities. The local HOA/Property management company manages items related to your home.
Contacting Deb via email at
[email protected]
prior to your closing to obtain the New Owner Booklet & Packet will help expedite establishing your account once the Deed and check are received. The title company usually mails both items to the Master Association following your closing.
Once the closing has occurred, we will provide each new owner with one complimentary RAD (vehicle decal) and one complimentary FOB (Wellness Center & walking gate access). One additional FOB can be purchased; there is a maximum of 2 FOB’s permitted per membership. Additional RAD’s can be purchased by providing a copy of your vehicle registration to the Administration Office.
Congratulations! Now it's time to enjoy the many opportunities included with your membership at Countryside.
By-Laws
End Mini-Page 598171
